questions.description: The amount of glucose present in urine of normal man is :
The excretory material in many bony fishes, aquatic amphibians and aquatic insects that is generally eliminated by diffusion across body surfaces or through gill surfaces is :
Protonephridia or flame cells are the excretory structures present in :
Antennal glands help in removal of nitrogenous wastes in :

Assertion (A) : Terrestrial adaptation necessitated the production of lesser toxic nitrogenous wastes like urea and uric acid for conservation of water. 
 Reason (R) : Ammonia is the least toxic form and requires large amounts of water for its elimination.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: In ureotelic animals, urea is formed by :
Which of the following is not present in sweat ?
Which of the following pair is wrong ?
The kidneys not only remove the waste products from the blood but also play a very important role in maintaining  :

options.description: Constant composition of the blood irrespective of the nature of the food or fluid intake

questions.description: Nitrogenous waste products are eliminated mainly as :

options.description: Urea in tadpole & ammonia in adult frog
Ammonia in tadpole and urea in adult frog
Urea in both tadpole & adult frog
Urea in tadpole and uric acid in adult frog

questions.description: Correct order of excretory organs in Cockroach, Earthworm and Rabbit respectively :
Uricotelism is found in :
A terrestrial animal must be able to :

options.description: Excrete large amount of water in urine
Actively pump salts out through the skin
Excrete large amounts of salts in urine

questions.description: Vitamin excreted in urine by higher vertebrates is :
Nearly all of the essential nutrients and 70 – 80 percent of electrolytes and water are reabsorbed in which segament of nephron :
The filtration slits are formed by which of the following layers of filtration membrane ?
Select the incorrect statement w.r.t. cortical nephrons:

options.description: Loop of Henle is short and extends superficially in the medulla
They are the most abundant ype of nephrons in kidneys
Vasa recta is well developed in cortical nephrons
Malpighian corpuscle, PCT and DCT of these nephrons are situated in outer cortex

questions.description: Which of the following is not considered as component of tubular parts of nephron?
Even under the influence of ADH, maximum reabsorption of water occurs in which of the following segments of a nephron ?
Choose the option that would be found in medullary pyramid of kidneys in man :
In which segment of nephron does tubular fluid have the highest osmolarity ?
Peritubular capillaries of the nephron arise from :

Juxtamedullary nephron differes from cortical nephron in :
 (a) Number  
 (b) Length of loop of Henle 
 (c) Presence of vasa recta 
 (d) Location in kidney
Proximal convoluted tubule of nephron differs from distal convoluted tubule in :

options.description: Having modified cells called macula densa
Allowing reabsorption of most of the salts and water

questions.description:
A special sensitive region called juxta glomerular apparatus (JGA) is formed by certain cells of :
 (A) Distal convoluted tubule 
 (B) Afferent arteriole 
 (C) Efferent arteriole
Which out of the four parts mentioned below does not constitute a part of single uriniferous tubule ?
If Henle's loop were absent from mammalian nephron, which of the following is to be expected?

options.description: There will be no urine formation
There will be hardly any change in the quality and quantity of urine formed
The urine will be more concentrated
The urine will be more dilute

questions.description: Long loop–shaped capillaries extending from efferent arterioles in kidneys which seem parallel to Henle's loop are :
The parts of nephron situated in cortical region of kidney are :

options.description: Loop of Henle, PCT and collecting duct
Collecting duct, PCT and malpighian corpuscle
PCT, DCT and Loop of Henle

questions.description: Which one of the following statement is incorrect?

options.description: The medullary zone of kidney is divided into a few conical masses called medullary pyramids projecting into calyces
Inside the kidney the cortical region extends in between the medullary pyramids as renal pelvis
Glomerulus along with Bowman's capsule is called the renal corpuscle
Renal corpuscle, proximal convoluted tubule (PCT) and distal convoluted tubule (DCT) of the nephron are situated in the cortical region of kidney

questions.description: Which of the following is correct ?

options.description: Afferent arteriole is narrower than the efferent arteriole
Efferent vein is narrower than venule
Efferent arteriole is narrower than afferent arteriole
Both afferent and efferent arteriole are of same diameter

questions.description:
In human, excretory system consists of : 
 I. Pair of kidneys  
II. One pair of ureters
 III. Urinary bladder 
 IV. Urethra
 V. Skin   VI. Lungs 
 VII. Liver

options.description: I, II, III, IV, V, VI & VII

questions.description:
Out of the four parts given below, which parts play significant role in forming concentrated urine in human ? 
 I. Loop of henle 
 II. Glomerulus 
 III. Bowman's capsule
  IV. Vasa recta 
 The correct option is :
Ureter, blood vessels and nerves enter in to the kidney through :
The human kidney :

options.description: Concentrates the urine by actively transporting water out of the filtrate
Produces more dilute urine when the collecting ducts become less permeable to water
Responds to antidiuretic hormone by increasing urine output
Gets rid of urea from the body by secreting it into the descending arm of the loop of Henle

questions.description:
Layers between the glomerulus and Bowman's capsule through which the filtration takes place are: 
 I. Endothelium of the glomerular blood vessel 
 II. Cellular basement membrane
 III. Basement membrane between the endothelium of glomerular blood vessels and epithelium of the Bowman's capsule 
 IV. Epithelium of the Bowmans's capsule
Glomeruls is a tuft capillaries formed by ....A.... (A fine branch of renal artery). Blood from the glomerulus is carried away by an ......B......
The amount of filtrate formed by the kidneys per minute is 125 ml. This is called
The volume of blood filtered by kidneys per minute which constitutes roughly 20% of the blood pumped out by each ventricle of the heart in a minute is :
In a healthy human, amount of urea excreted per day is :
Mark the incorrect statement w.r.t. counter current mechanism :

options.description: Osmolarity of filtrate increases while moving down the descending limb of loop of Henle
There will be no urine formation if loop of Henle is absent in mammalian nephrons
NaCl and urea maintain the osmolarity gradient in medulla
Osmolarity of fluid moving out from the collecting duct is four times that of plasma

questions.description: Which of the following statement is not true ?

options.description: Ascending limb of loop of Henle is permeable to urea
DCT functions in K⁺, Na⁺ homeostasis
Descending limb is impermeable to water
Loop of Henle is largely responsible for  concentrating urine

questions.description: Hypertonicity of filtrate is minimum at :
Concentration of urine depends upon which of the following ?

options.description: Network of capillaries arising from glomerulus

questions.description: In which part of nephron, water is obliged to follow the solutes when they are reabsorbed?
What will be the osmolarity of glomerular filtrate leaving the proximal convoluted tubule in normal healthy person ?

Given below are following statements : 
 (a) On an average, 18–38 mg of urea is excreted
  (b) The normal level of urea in the blood ranges from 25–30 g per 100 ml of blood  
 (c) GFR in a healthy individual is about 125 ml/day
  (d)  About 99% of filtrate is reabsorbed by the nephric tubules
 Choose the option which includes incorrect statements :
Glomerular filtrate contains :

options.description: Blood with protein but without blood cells
Blood without blood cells and proteins

questions.description: All of the following parts of the nephron are permeable to water, except :

options.description: Ascending limb of loop of Henle
Descending limb of loop of Henle

questions.description: During urine formation, the tubular cells secrete substances like H⁺, K⁺ and NH₃ into the filtrate, this process is called :
On an average, _____ml of blood is filtered by the kidneys per minute which constitute roughly _____ of the blood pumped out by each ventricle of the heart in a minute :
Concentration of sodium and chloride ions is lowest :

options.description: In the middle of Henle's loop

questions.description: If Henle's loop were absent from mammalian nephron, which of the following is to be expected:

options.description: There will be no urine formation
There will be hardly any change in the quality and quantity of urine formed
The urine will be more concentrated
The urine will be more diluted

questions.description: Choose the mismatched part of nephron with their function :

Urine formed by nephrons is ultimately carried to ......A.... where it is stored till a voluntary signal is given by the .....B..... . This signal is initiated by  .....C .... of urinary bladder.
Choose the correct option for A, B and  C.
The glomerular capillary blood pressure causes filtration of blood through ?

options.description: Basement membrane between these two layers

questions.description: Which of the following play a significant role in the maintenance of high osmolarity of medulla interstitial fluid ?

Large amount of water is ........A........ from collecting duct to produce .......B....... urine. This segment allows passage of small amounts of .....C..... into interstitium of medulla to keep up the osmolarity. Here, A, B and C refers to :

Which of the following statement is/are true ? 
 I. Glomerular filtrate is isotonic to plasma 
 II. When the urine passes into collecting tubule, it becomes hypotonic 
 III. Filtrate is isotonic in proximal convoluted tubule 
 IV. Filtrate becomes more and more hypotonic as it passes through descending limb of Henle's loop
 Choose the correct option :

Which of the following features activates the JG cells?
 I. Fall in glomerular blood pressure 
 II. Fall in glomerular blood flow 
 III. Fall in GFR
 Choose the correct option :
Parasympathetic activity during micturition causes:

options.description: Contraction of bladder muscle and contraction of intgernal urethral sphincter
Contraction of bladder muscle and relaxation of internal urethral sphincter
Relaxation of bladder muscle and relaxation of internal urethral sphincter
Relaxation of bladder muscle and contraction of internal urethral sphincter

questions.description:
Select the correct order of osmolarity changes in filtrate w.r.t. plasma in : 
 Bowmans capsule → PCT  → Thin part of descending limb of loop of henle → Thin part of ascending limb of loop of henle  → DCT →  End of collecting duct

options.description: Isotonic  → Isotonic  →  Hypotonic  → Hypertonic  →  Hypotonic  →  Hypotonic
Isotonic  →  Isotonic →  Hypertonic  →  Hypertonic → Hypotonic →  Hypertonic
Isotonic  → Hypertonic → Isotonic → Hypertonic → Hypotonic → Hypertonic
Hypotonic  → Isotonic  → Hypertonic  → Isotonic  → Hypotonic  → Hypertonic

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : In the descending limb of loop of Henle, the filtrate is hypertonic, while in ascending limb of loop of Henle, the filtrate is hypotonic.  
 Reason (R) : Descending limb is impermeable to Na⁺, while ascending limb is impermeable to H₂O.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description: Which blood vessel contains the least amount of urea ?
Which hormone does not lead to reabsorption of Na⁺ and water from the distal parts of the renal tubule ?
The check on RAAS is maintained by :
The release of renin from JG cells in triggered in response to :
Angiotensin–II is responsible for all of the following except :

options.description: Decreased reabsorption of Na⁺ from renal tubules

questions.description: All of the following are excreted through sebum except :

All of the following functions are attributed to ADH, except : 
 (A)  Increase in glomerular blood flow  
 (B)  Promoting diuresis  
 (C) Decrease in blood pressure 
 (D)  Increase in body fluid volume
In response to decrease in blood volume and blood pressure which of the following do not occur ?
Amount of urine is affected by :
In artificial kidney, dialysis fluid contains same quantities of all the substances as normal plasma, except :
Which of the following statement is incorrect ?
Which one influences the activity of kidney ?
Angiotensin –II increases the blood volume by :

options.description: Signaling Loop of Henle to reabsorb more NaCl and water
Stimulating adrenal gland to release aldosterone
By stimulating the release of ADH
Stimulating the release of ANF from heart

questions.description: When the volume of body fluid falls below normal, ADH :

options.description: Decreases permeability of distal convoluted tubule and collecting tubule
Increases permeability of distal convoluted tubule and collecting tubule
Has nothing to do with permeability of convoluted tubule
Decreases permeability of proximal convoluted tubule

questions.description: The micturition relflex does not involve :

options.description: Activation of stretch receptors of urinary bladder
Contraction of smooth muscles of the bladder

questions.description: Workers in deep mines usually suffer from dehydration because :

options.description: Water is lost due to evaporation
Water is lost due to defeacation
Water is lost in the form of urines
Water is lost along with salts in the form of sweat

questions.description: ANF mechanism checks on :
Diuresis is the condition in which :

options.description: The excretion of volume of urine increases
The excretion of volume of urine decreases
The kidney fails to excrete urine
The water balance of the body is disturbed

questions.description: The appearance of albumin in the urine is most likely due to :

options.description: Decrease in the blood osmotic pressure
Damage to the proximal convoluted tubules

questions.description: Why do we pass more urine in wet and cold season?

options.description: Impairment of water absorption by nephrons

questions.description: In a comparison of amounts of urea in human urine, the largest amount of urea would be found with a diet very rich in :

During hemodialysis process : 
 I. Blood drained from a convenient artery and anticoagulant is added (heparin) 
 II. Removal of nitrogenous waste from blood 
 III. Blood is passed through a coiled porous cellophane membrane of tube bathing in dialysis fluid 
 IV. Blood is mixed with antitheparin and passed into vein 
 Arange the steps :

Which of the following statements are not incorrect ?
 (i) Liver, the largest gland in our body secretes cholesterol, steroid hormones, vitamins and drugs
 (ii) Sebaceous glands eliminate certain substances like urea, sterols and sebum 
 (iii) Sweat produced by sweat glands is a oily fluid containing NaCl 
 (iv) In uremic patients urea and glucose can be removed by a process called hemodialysis

Assertion (A) : Atrial Natriuretic factor is released by wall of atria. 
 Reason (R) : It inhibits the release of renin from juxta glomerular apparatus.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : Diabetes insipidus is marked by excessive urination and too much thirst of water. 
 Reason (R) : Anti-diuretic hormone (ADH) is synthesized by the posterior lobe of pituitary gland.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false

questions.description:
You and your study partner want to draw the pathway that controls the reabsorption of sodium ion when blood pressure falls. Which of the following is the correct sequence of events ?
 (a) Aldosterone is released 
 (b) Kidney tubules reabsorb Na⁺
 (c) Renin is released 
 (d) Juxtaglomerular apparatus (JGA) recognizes a drop in blood pressure 
 (e) Angiotensin II is produced

Identify the wrong statements about human excretory system and choose the correct option accordingly :
 I. Kidneys are reddish brown and bean–shaped structure 
 II. Kidneys are situated between the last thoracic and third lumbar vertebra 
 III. Each kidney of an adult human measures
10–12 cm in length, 5-7 cm in width, 2-3 cm thickness, and average weight 120-170 gram
The following substances are the excretory products in animals. Choose the least toxic form among them?
Filtration of the blood takes place at :
Which of the following statements is correct?

options.description: ADH – prevents conversion of angiotensinogen in blood to angiotensin

questions.description: The pH of human urine is approximately :

options.description: Birds and land snails are uricotelic animals
Mammals and frogs are ureotelic animals
Aquatic amphibians and aquatic insects are ammonotelic animals

questions.description: Which of the following pairs is wrong?
The condition of accumulation of urea in the blood is termed as :
Which one of the following is also known as antidiuretic hormone?
Dialysing unit (artificial kidney) contains a fluid which is almost same as plasma except that it has :

options.description: Counter current mechanism in Henle’s loop/ Vasa recta
